cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow, turn north and northeast along the upper Texas coast Tuesday–Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Bay, Texas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, Texas to Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely Monday into Tuesday with gusts possibly exceeding 60 mph at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Matagorda Bay including Calhoun Port Authority beginning late Sunday and peaking Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 20 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents; possible minor to moderate river flooding.
